snippet: In a study involving about 10,000 people, the new test detected 92 percent of the cancers picked up by colonoscopy, according to the company that makes the test.
abstract: Study released by Exact Sciences Corporation shows that new noninvasive screening test can detect most cases of colorectal cancer and precancerous polyps, potentially reducing death toll from disease; still, results fall short of investor expectations, sending company shares down 20 percent.
lead_paragraph: In a study involving about 10,000 people, the new test detected 92 percent of the cancers picked up by colonoscopy, according to the company that makes the test.

headline.seo: New Test Detects Most Colorectal Cancers, Study Finds
headline.main: Noninvasive Cancer Test Is Effective, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Noninvasive Cancer Test Is Effective, Study Finds
